member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines how the bars are displayed. The display direction specifies which axis determines the origin (start) and end of the bar and the bar is drawn in a from-to manner - from the origin to the value. When this property is null, the chart calculates an automatic display direction.

member.name: T:Telerik.Windows.Controls.ChartView.SurfaceSeries3DColorizationMode
member.summary: Determines the appearance of the 3D surface. This may include specific positions, triangle indexes, texture coordinates, and material.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.ChartView.SurfaceSeries3DColorizationMode.Blend
member.summary: The surface is divided into triangles determined by the original data point centers. Each pixel in each triangle is a color blend between the three colors (determined by the three data points) and this color is determined by the pixel's proximity to the vertices.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.ChartView.SurfaceSeries3DColorizationMode.Tiles
member.summary: Each data point is presented by a tile with a solid color.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines how the 3D points are connected, i.e. how the surface is displayed. For example if the display direction is the Z axis, then the points are connected in a way to respect their 2D position in the XY plane. When this property is null, the chart calculates an automatic display direction.

member.summary: Triangulation algorithm creating initial triangles by connecting radial diagonals starting from a single point from the points convex hull.

member.summary: Delaunay triangulation algorithm which guarantees that no triangle in entirely inside the circumscribed circle of some other triangle.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates where the ticks originate. The position of the ticks is determined based on the combination of the and TickOrigin values. The axis will generate the ticks and labels in a way so that a label would be positioned at the given TickOrigin.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.ChartView.Chart3DCameraBehavior.GetIsRotationEnabled(System.Windows.DependencyObject)
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the object should be rotated by a camera behavior.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.ChartView.Chart3DCameraBehavior.SetIsRotationEnabled(System.Windows.DependencyObject,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets a value indicating whether the object should be rotated by a camera behavior.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.ChartView.Chart3DCameraBehavior.Distance
member.summary: Gets or sets the distance. This property has a different meaning for the different cameras. When a PerspectiveCamera is in use, the distance is the radius of the sphere that the camera is positioned on. When an OrthographicCamera is in use, the distance is the Width of the camera.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.ChartView.Chart3DCameraBehavior.MinDistance
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum distance.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.ChartView.Chart3DCameraBehavior.MaxDistance
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum distance.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.ChartView.Chart3DCameraBehavior.FirstAngle
member.summary: Gets or sets the angle between the axis to the right and the projection of the line between the camera position and plot area center onto the horizontal plane. The axis to the right is considered to be the one that goes to the right when one axis goes up and another goes towards the viewer. The horizontal plane is considered to be the plane that is defined by the right axis and the axis that goes towards the viewer.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.ChartView.Chart3DCameraBehavior.SecondAngle
member.summary: Gets or sets the angle between the UpDirection axis and the line between the camera position and plot area center.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.ChartView.Chart3DCameraBehavior.MinSecondAngle
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum SecondAngle.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.ChartView.Chart3DCameraBehavior.MaxSecondAngle
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum SecondAngle.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.ChartView.Chart3DCameraBehavior.FieldOfView
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that represents the PerspectiveCamera camera's horizontal field of view.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.ChartView.Chart3DCameraBehavior.DragToRotateKeyCombinations
member.summary: Gets the drag-to-rotate key combinations. Drag rotation is performed when at least one key combination is fully satisfied. When this collection is empty rotation is performed when the left mouse button is pressed.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.ChartView.Chart3DCameraBehavior.FieldOfViewModifierKeys
member.summary: Gets the keys that allow modifying the field of view on mouse wheel. The field of view is updated when at least one of these keys is pressed. When this collection is empty the field of view is updated when the left shift and/or right shift is pressed.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.ChartView.Chart3DCameraBehavior.UpDirection
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating which axis defines the up direction of the camera.

member.summary: This collection contains the behaviors for the .

member.summary: Defines the first axis. This value is coordinate-system specific. It represents the X (or the Horizontal) axis for a Cartesian coordinate system and the Value (or the Radius) axis for a Polar coordinate system.

member.summary: Points are plotted in the middle of the range, defined between each two ticks.

member.name: F:Telerik.Charting.AxisPlotMode.OnTicks
member.summary: Points are plotted over each tick.

member.name: F:Telerik.Charting.AxisPlotMode.OnTicksPadded
member.summary: Points are plotted over each tick with half a step padding applied on both ends of the axis.

member.summary: A class that encapsulates the logic for selecting a bubble size. This bubble-size-selector implementation works in relative mode to determine the bubble sizes. The bubble sizes are calculated in accordance to the bubble-size-function and with respect to the minimum value, maximum value, minimum size and maximum size. Note: original width = 1.8, result width = 1; original right = 2.4, result right = 2. (0.6, 0, 2.0, 0) results in (1, 0, 2, 0).

member.summary: Gets or sets the gap (in the range [0, 1]) to be applied when calculating each plotted position.

member.summary: Gets or sets the user-defined step between two adjacent ticks on the axis. Specify TimeSpan.Zero to clear the value. If not specified, the step will be automatically determined, depending on the smallest difference between any two dates.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.ChartView.DateTimeContinuousAxis.MajorStepUnit
member.summary: Gets or sets the unit that defines the custom major step of the axis. If no explicit step is defined, the axis will automatically calculate one, depending on the smallest difference between any two dates.

member.summary: Gets or sets the custom minimum of the axis. Specify DateTime.MinValue to clear the property value so that the minimum is auto-generated.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.ChartView.DateTimeContinuousAxis.Maximum
member.summary: Gets or sets the custom maximum of the axis. Specify DateTime.MaxValue to clear the property value so that the maximum is auto-generated.

member.summary: Gets or sets the mode which determines how points are plotted by this axis.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.ChartView.DateTimeContinuousAxis.TickOrigin
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates where the ticks originate. The position of the ticks is determined based on the combination of the and TickOrigin values. The axis will generate the ticks and labels in a way so that a label would be positioned at the given TickOrigin.

member.summary: Gets or sets the user-defined minimum of the axis. By default the axis itself will calculate the minimum, depending on the minimum of the plotted data points.
member.remarks: You can reset this property by setting it to double.NegativeInfinity to restore the default behavior.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.ChartView.PolarAxis.Maximum
member.summary: Gets or sets the user-defined maximum of the axis. By default the axis itself will calculate the maximum, depending on the maximum of the plotted data points.
member.remarks: You can reset this property by setting it to double.PositiveInfinity to restore the default behavior.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.ChartView.PieChartLabelsDisplayMode.Basic
member.summary: Labels will be positioned in a way to avoid overlapping.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.ChartView.PieChartLabelsDisplayMode.Outside
member.summary: Labels will be positioned outside the pie area in a way to avoid overlapping.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.ChartView.PieChartLabelsDisplayMode.Spider
member.summary: Classical spider mode - labels will be split into two clusters, left and right. The labels in the left cluster will be aligned to their right and the labels in the right cluster will be aligned to their left.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.ChartView.PieChartLabelsDisplayMode.SpiderUnaligned
member.summary: Labels will be split into two clusters - left and right, and will be positioned close to their belonging pie slice.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.ChartView.PieChartLabelsDisplayMode.SpiderAlignedOutwards
member.summary: Labels will be split into two clusters - left and right. The labels in the left cluster will be aligned to their left and the labels in the right cluster will be aligned to their right.
